content:
• Wednesday, February 22, 2012
  • ADI

    More on Analog Devices (NASDAQ:ADI): Q4 misses across the board on lower sales, as customers...

    More on Analog Devices (NASDAQ:ADI): Q4 misses across the board on lower sales, as customers pared back orders on fears about economy. The company also lowered FQ2 guidance to below Street estimates, noting on the conference call that some customers are still working through inventories. Shares -2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:45 PM

  • BSX

    Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) says its ION and TAXUS Liberte Paclitaxel-Eluting Coronary Stent...

    Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) says its ION and TAXUS Liberte Paclitaxel-Eluting Coronary Stent Systems have received FDA approval for use in patients experiencing a heart attack. They are the only drug-eluting stent systems in the country with an approved indication to treat heart attack patients. Shares +1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 PM

    Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) shares resume trading, +90.6% after an FDA advisory panel votes to recommend Qnexa. Also with weight-loss drugs waiting for approval: ARNA +18.8%, OREX +14%.

    Prospect Capital (NASDAQ:PSEC) falls 3.3% AH after announcing a 12M share stock offering, good...

    Prospect Capital (NASDAQ:PSEC) falls 3.3% AH after announcing a 12M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $136.7M based on today's close. The money manager isn't providing any details about how it plans to invest the proceeds.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM

    DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q4 EPS of $0.07 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $328M (+52% Y/Y) beats by...

  • VVUS

    Though Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) is still halted following the FDA's approval of Qnexa, Arena...

    Though Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) is still halted following the FDA's approval of Qnexa, Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) is up 11.6% AH, and Orexigen Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OREX) is up 14.3%. Arena and Orexigen have weight-loss drugs of their own (I, II) that are awaiting FDA approval.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM

    CVR Partners (NYSE:UAN): Q4 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $87.6M (+122% Y/Y) beats by...

  • GNK

    Genko Shipping (GNK -1.7%), which fell slightly in trading today after posting its Q4 report, is...

    Genko Shipping (GNK -1.7%), which fell slightly in trading today after posting its Q4 report, is down 9.9% AH after announcing a $50M stock offering, which based on today's close would boost its share count by 17%. The drybulk shipper, which has nearly $1.7B in long-term debt on its balance sheet, only says it plans to use the proceeds for "general corporate purposes."

     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM | 1 Comment

  • LB

    More on Limited Brands' FQ4: Though results beat estimates, the company expects FQ1 EPS of...

    More on Limited Brands' FQ4: Though results beat estimates, the company expects FQ1 EPS of $0.35-$0.40, below a $0.44 consensus. In addition, Limited expects FY13 EPS of $2.60-$2.80, below a consensus of $2.91. However, February same-store sales are expected to grow in the mid-to-high single digits, above prior guidance. A new $500M stock buyback program has been authorized. LTD -3.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • ANW

    Aegean Marine Petroleum Network (OTC:ANW): Q4 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.74B...

    Aegean Marine Petroleum Network (OTC:ANW): Q4 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.74B (+19.7% Y/Y) beats by $60M. Shares +1.8% AH. (PR)

    Advance America Cash Advance Centers (NYSE:AEA): Q4 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.15. Revenue of...

    Advance America Cash Advance Centers (NYSE:AEA): Q4 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $182M (+13.7% Y/Y) beats by $12M. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)

    Limited Brands (LTD): Q4 EPS of $1.50 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $3.52B (+1.7% Y/Y) beats by $50M. Shares -2.6% AH. (PR)

  • AWAY

    More on HomeAway's Q4: In spite of posting a small net loss for the quarter, free cash flow was...

    More on HomeAway's Q4: In spite of posting a small net loss for the quarter, free cash flow was $15.4M (+19% Y/Y). However, the company is guiding for Q1 revenue of $63.7M-$64M, below a $65.7M consensus. Moreover, it expects 2012 revenue of $276M-$280M, below a $284M consensus. With shares trading at over 9x trailing sales going into earnings, there was little room for error. AWAY -7.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • ONXX

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX): Q4 EPS of $1.50 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $237M (+239%...

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX): Q4 EPS of $1.50 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $237M (+239% Y/Y) beats by $24M. Shares +4.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • PPO

    More on Polypore International (NYSE:PPO): Q4 misses estimates across the board, despite a 12%...

    More on Polypore International (NYSE:PPO): Q4 misses estimates across the board, despite a 12% Y/Y jump in revenue and sales. The stock is down after hours however, as the company says it expects Q1 results to come in below expectations. Shares -11.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • CXO

    Concho Resources (NYSE:CXO): Q4 EPS of $4.15 may not be comparable to consensus of $1.17....

    Concho Resources (NYSE:CXO): Q4 EPS of $4.15 may not be comparable to consensus of $1.17. Revenue of $478M (+51.5% Y/Y) beats by $26M. Shares -3.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • HPQ

    More on H-P's FQ1: Sales fell across all major regions, and were hurt by a 15% Y/Y drop in PC...

    More on H-P's FQ1: Sales fell across all major regions, and were hurt by a 15% Y/Y drop in PC sales - much worse than FQ4's 2% drop, and Dell's small decline. Share was also lost in enterprise hardware, where sales fell 10% thanks to server/storage declines. Services +1%, and printing -7%. High-margin software sales were up 30%, boosted by the Autonomy acquisition. $780M in shares repurchased. HPQ -1.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 4 Comments
  • WLL

    Whiting Petroleum (NYSE:WLL): Q4 EPS of $1.05 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $498.6M (+20.6% Y/Y)...

    Whiting Petroleum (NYSE:WLL): Q4 EPS of $1.05 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $498.6M (+20.6% Y/Y) beats by $9M. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM

    | 4:13 PM
  • HPQ

    Hewlett-Packard (NYSE:HPQ): FQ1 EPS of $0.92 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $30B (-7% Y/Y) misses by...

    Hewlett-Packard (NYSE:HPQ): FQ1 EPS of $0.92 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $30B (-7% Y/Y) misses by $700M. Company expects FQ2 EPS of $0.88-$0.91, below $0.95 consensus. Reiterates guidance for FY12 EPS of $4, below $4.08 consensus. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR): Q4 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $75.5M (+157% Y/Y)....

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR): Q4 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $75.5M (+157% Y/Y). Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • ADI

    Analog Devices (NASDAQ:ADI): FQ1 EPS of $0.46 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $648M (-11% Y/Y)...

    Analog Devices (NASDAQ:ADI): FQ1 EPS of $0.46 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $648M (-11% Y/Y) misses by $14M. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -2.5%) trades down after missing Q4 estimates late yesterday, despite a...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -2.5%) trades down after missing Q4 estimates late yesterday, despite a big jump in profit. Revenue actually rose 38% Y/Y on higher sales and production, as well as from a hedging gain that boosted bottom-line results. Additionally, the company says it plans to more than double its oil and liquids production by 2015 in an effort to become a top U.S. oil producer.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 6 Comments
  • VR

    Flagstone Reinsurance (FSR -13.2%) shares slump on the company's Q4 loss, as a surge in...

    Flagstone Reinsurance (FSR -13.2%) shares slump on the company's Q4 loss, as a surge in catastrophes again weighed on results. KBW cuts its price target and EPS estimates after the bottom-line miss.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • CQB

    Chiquita Brands (CQB +9.2%) posts a narrower-than-expected Q4 loss and says it is refocusing its...

    Chiquita Brands (CQB +9.2%) posts a narrower-than-expected Q4 loss and says it is refocusing its salad business, which has struggled amid stiff private-label competition. The owner of Fresh Express bagged salads plans to expand its organic offerings and offer heads of lettuce while going into private-label. CQB also plans to consolidate several Midwest processing plants into one Chicago facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • GRMN

    Garmin (GRMN +9.2%) COO Cliff Premble highlights during a conference call that the company sees...

    Garmin (GRMN +9.2%) COO Cliff Premble highlights during a conference call that the company sees its marine segment as a key driver for growth with new sonar and autopilot solutions that serve the sail and large boat market. In 2011 marine revenue grew 12% - compared to a 5% decline in automotive/mobile revenue - and for 2012 the company targets steady growth of 5%-10% for the segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • TOL

    Among homebuilder shares, Toll Brothers' (TOL -4.9%) unexpected FQ1 loss outweighs January's...

    Among homebuilder shares, Toll Brothers' (TOL -4.9%) unexpected FQ1 loss outweighs January's rise in U.S. existing home sales: BZH -5.5%, KBH -4.5%, MHO -5.9%, MTH -5.5%, RYL -4.4%. Shares slide despite optimistic remarks from TOL CEO Doug Yearley that "in general the market feels healthier than it did one year ago."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • CELL

    Shares of Brightpoint (CELL -10.9%) drop after the wireless-equipment provider trimmed the top...

    Shares of Brightpoint (CELL -10.9%) drop after the wireless-equipment provider trimmed the top end of its FY12 earnings guidance after losing a major logistic-services customer to a competitor.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • DCI

    Donaldson (DCI -3.3%) dips after its FQ2 results missed estimates this morning. Earnings...

    Donaldson (DCI -3.3%) dips after its FQ2 results missed estimates this morning. Earnings actually rose 21% as the industrial filter maker booked a double-digit jump in sales in its key engine-products business. But shares fell as Donaldson reined in its targets for the full year, citing a stronger U.S. dollar

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • MDT

    Analysts at Credit Suisse and Deutsche Bank downgrade stock ratings for Medtronic (MDT -2%), as...

    Analysts at Credit Suisse and Deutsche Bank downgrade stock ratings for Medtronic (MDT -2%), as the medical device maker deals with a slowdown in some of its end markets. Some 60% of MDT’s current sales are in declining or low growth markets, CS says; DB is concerned that the company will have trouble growing in the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • CLH

    Clean Harbors (CLH +6%) moves up after beating Q4 estimates earlier this morning. Revenue jumped...

    Clean Harbors (CLH +6%) moves up after beating Q4 estimates earlier this morning. Revenue jumped 30% Y/Y on better margins and double-digit organic growth. The waste management company also boosts its 2012 forecast, now seeing revenues of $2.2B - $2.25B, versus the Street view of $2.19B.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • FCEL

    Another big day for FuelCell Energy (FCEL +14.3%), as the maker of fuel-cell power plants...

    Another big day for FuelCell Energy (FCEL +14.3%), as the maker of fuel-cell power plants announces plans to form a German-based JV with Fraunhofer IKTS to expand in the European market. Yesterday, FCEL shares moved on Apple's plans to power its North Carolina data center with major solar and fuel-cell installations.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • AFAM

    Shares of home-health nursing services provider Almost Family (AFAM +13.5%) jump after its Q4...

    Shares of home-health nursing services provider Almost Family (AFAM +13.5%) jump after its Q4 beat estimates earlier today. Top and bottom-line results both rose as gains from its recent acquisition of Cambridge Home Health Care helped overshadow the unfavorable impact of Medicare reimbursement rate cuts in its visiting nurse segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • GAME

    Shanda Games (GAME +7.9%) gains after beating Q4 estimates late yesterday. Profit rose 23.7% Y/Y...

    Shanda Games (GAME +7.9%) gains after beating Q4 estimates late yesterday. Profit rose 23.7% Y/Y as the game developer's overseas product sales and expanded game portfolio helped lift revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • GT

    Goodyear (GT -2.5%) "could go to zero," Wasatch Funds' Michael Shinnick says, citing balance...

    Goodyear (GT -2.5%) "could go to zero," Wasatch Funds' Michael Shinnick says, citing balance sheet weakness and massive underfunding of its pensions. Shares are -7.2% YTD but trade at ~$13, pretty far from zero and well above the 52-week low of $8.53. GT recently showed up in Randall Forsyth’s rundown of companies with the biggest pension shortfalls.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • GPC

    Genuine Parts (GPC -1.7%) dips after Gabelli downgraded the shares to Hold on valuation on the...

    Genuine Parts (GPC -1.7%) dips after Gabelli downgraded the shares to Hold on valuation on the back of the company's Q4 results.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • CHS

    Janney Montgomery weighs in on Chico's (CHS +17.5%) after the firm rocked a better-than-expected...

    Janney Montgomery weighs in on Chico's (CHS +17.5%) after the firm rocked a better-than-expected FQ4 report. Analysts reiterated a Buy rating on CHS to go along with an improved price target of $17 and increased estimates for FY12 and FY13 earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • STLD

    Steel Dynamics (STLD -4%) dips after Longbow downgraded the shares to Neutral earlier today,...

    Steel Dynamics (STLD -4%) dips after Longbow downgraded the shares to Neutral earlier today, based on expectations for a price correction following higher hot rolled coil steel prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate (LGF +2.2%) makes another 52-week high thanks to an upgrade to Buy from Miller Tabak....

    Lions Gate (LGF +2.2%) makes another 52-week high thanks to an upgrade to Buy from Miller Tabak. Like Jim Cramer, Miller sees the upcoming release of The Hunger Games giving Lions Gate's bottom line and stock price a boost, and the same goes for its pending acquisition of Summit Entertainment.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • URS

    URS (URS +2.6%) moves higher on a couple of upgrades, to Outperform from Neutral at both...

    URS (URS +2.6%) moves higher on a couple of upgrades, to Outperform from Neutral at both Macquarie and Baird. Macquarie cites the Flint acquisition which adds high quality upstream hydrocarbon exposure and diversifies it away from U.S. government exposure.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • RIGL

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (RIGL +4.9%) kicks up a gain after Citigroup upgrades shares to a Buy...

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (RIGL +4.9%) kicks up a gain after Citigroup upgrades shares to a Buy rating from Neutral. SA author Stephen Simpson notes that if the firm strikes some success with studies of drugs in its pipeline it may make a juicy acquisition candidate for AstraZeneca.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM

  • Chinese game developer KongZhong (KONS +19.3%) soars after reporting Q4 revenue of $39.3M (+9%...

    Chinese game developer KongZhong (KONS +19.3%) soars after reporting Q4 revenue of $39.3M (+9% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.18; the latter is well ahead of a Street estimate of $0.08. Growth was driven by a 50% Y/Y increase in PC gaming revenue, which offset a 24% decline mobile gaming revenue. KongZhong expects Q1 revenue of $41.5M-$42.5M, above a $39.1M consensus. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon Technology (RBCN +3%) gains on positive comments out of Piper Jaffray today, saying...

    Rubicon Technology (RBCN +3%) gains on positive comments out of Piper Jaffray today, saying channel checks from the LED China conference in Guangzhou confirm that sapphire pricing has likely stabilized and 6" adoption appears to be increasing in Korea and Japan.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • MGM

    Execs with MGM say on a conference call that the casino operator plans to spend $2B-$2.5B on its...

    Execs with MGM say on a conference call that the casino operator plans to spend $2B-$2.5B on its Macau facility over the next 36 months, further aligning the firm's results to gambling in the PRC's special administrative region. Shares are off 2.1%, recovering half of the ground lost after the company released its Q4 results premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • GOOG

    Respondents to a poll at Android and Me are mostly positive on Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) reported...

    Respondents to a poll at Android and Me are mostly positive on Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) reported plans to sell information-streaming glasses. But Larry Dignan declares the "composite sketch" of a buyer to be that of a "total dork." MediaPost, meanwhile, thinks Google could collect a lot of valuable data from the glasses. Microvision (MVIS -6.3%), which has long sought to commercialize such glasses, could be selling off on the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • GSK

    Human Genome (HGSI -6.2%) trades down after RBC cut the shares to Sector Perform on valuation,...

    Human Genome (HGSI -6.2%) trades down after RBC cut the shares to Sector Perform on valuation, citing high consensus estimates for Benlysta.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • HSTM

    HealthStream (HSTM +23.1%) soars after beating EPS estimates by a penny and issuing rosy 2012...

    HealthStream (HSTM +23.1%) soars after beating EPS estimates by a penny and issuing rosy 2012 guidance. The web-based education provider for the health care industry says it expects 2012 revenue to increase 21%-25% Y/Y and operating income to move up 20%-26%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • ATRI

    Shares of Atrion (ATRI -15.8%) sink after the firm reports Q4 revenue fell off 4% Y/Y due to a...

    Shares of Atrion (ATRI -15.8%) sink after the firm reports Q4 revenue fell off 4% Y/Y due to a customer that pushed off delivery on a large shipment to January. The firm also says that the same customer now has too much inventory, and as a result it expects earnings for the full year 2012 to decline by approximately 10%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • MTSN

    Mattson Technology (MTSN -15.4%) tanks after traders take issue with a few things - like a 52%...

    Mattson Technology (MTSN -15.4%) tanks after traders take issue with a few things - like a 52% increase in cost of sales for example -while parsing through details of the company's 10-K released today.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -5.5%) shares continue to slide, apparently from yesterday’s news that...

    Netflix (NFLX -5.5%) shares continue to slide, apparently from yesterday’s news that Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) will offer its own streaming video service, but the company receives favorable comments today following Credit Suisse's endorsement. Piper Jaffray reiterates its Overweight rating and $130 price target, believing NFLX's "content lead is growing" even as Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) and Hulu are “gaining traction."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 4 Comments
  • CHS

    Chico's FAS (CHS +15.8%) is off to the races after trouncing FQ4 estimates on the back of 8.7%...

    Chico's FAS (CHS +15.8%) is off to the races after trouncing FQ4 estimates on the back of 8.7% same-store sales growth - up sharply from FQ3's 3.7%. Also helping is the apparel retailer's guidance for FY13 (ends Jan. '13) revenue of $2.5B, which is above a $2.4B consensus and assumes "mid-single-digit" same-store sales growth. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM

Sterne sees Dell's PC business suffering at the hands of Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), Acer, and H-P (NYSE:HPQ), while Citi doesn't expect Dell's soft gross margin to improve in FQ1.
